private_information: I can only manipulate blocks labeled with vowels: A E I O
vowel_agent.goal: Collaborate to rearrange all blocks so that the final configuration is a single stack with O on the table and the order O N M L K J I H G F E D C B A from bottom to top.

private_information: I can only manipulate blocks labeled with consonants: M G J D H F N C K L B
consonant_agent.goal: Collaborate to rearrange all blocks so that the final configuration is a single stack with O on the table and the order O N M L K J I H G F E D C B A from bottom to top.

orchestrator.goal: Integrate the agents' reports and produce a complete PDDL domain and problem for the FastDownwards planner that achieves the global stacking goal while respecting agent-specific move constraints.

public_information: There are two stacks on the table initially.
Only the top block of any stack can be moved.
Agents may move only one block at a time.
The environment enforces that vowel_agent may only move vowel-labeled blocks and consonant_agent may only move consonant-labeled blocks.
Initial configuration: Stack1 has M on the table with J on M, D on J, N on D, C on N, O on C. Stack2 has G on the table with E on G, A on E, H on A, F on H, K on F, L on K, B on L, I on B.
Goal configuration: A on B, B on C, C on D, D on E, E on F, F on G, G on H, H on I, I on J, J on K, K on L, L on M, M on N, N on O, O on table.

analysis.system_prompt: You are an agent that can manipulate only vowel-labeled blocks. You must not emit PDDL. Instead provide a structured report describing which vowel blocks are legally movable given the public initial configuration, the primitive action types you can perform restricted to vowels, and a concise sequence of local atomic moves you propose to help reach the global goal. Keep your reasoning explicit and list preconditions and effects of each proposed local move.
analysis.prompt: Your name is vowel_agent. Public information: {environment->public_information}. Your private knowledge: {agents->vowel_agent->private_information}. Global goal: {agents->vowel_agent->goal}. Provide a clear report listing: 1) which vowel blocks are currently top blocks you can move, 2) the legal primitive actions you can perform and their preconditions and effects, 3) a short ordered sequence of local moves (atomic moves) you propose. Do not produce PDDL.

analysis.system_prompt: You are an agent that can manipulate only consonant-labeled blocks. You must not emit PDDL. Instead provide a structured report describing which consonant blocks are legally movable given the public initial configuration, the primitive action types you can perform restricted to consonants, and a concise sequence of local atomic moves you propose to help reach the global goal. Keep your reasoning explicit and list preconditions and effects of each proposed local move.
analysis.prompt: Your name is consonant_agent. Public information: {environment->public_information}. Your private knowledge: {agents->consonant_agent->private_information}. Global goal: {agents->consonant_agent->goal}. Provide a clear report listing: 1) which consonant blocks are currently top blocks you can move, 2) the legal primitive actions you can perform and their preconditions and effects, 3) a short ordered sequence of local moves (atomic moves) you propose. Do not produce PDDL.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert in multi-agent PDDL modeling and planning for the FastDownwards planner. Your job is to integrate the structured reports from agents and produce a single complete PDDL domain and a PDDL problem file targeted for FastDownwards. Model the world so that the actions of vowel_agent and consonant_agent remain distinct and constrained: vowel actions may only move vowel-labeled blocks and consonant actions may only move consonant-labeled blocks. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags.
pddl.prompt: You are the orchestrator. Task goal: {agents->orchestrator->goal}. Use public information: {environment->public_information}. Here are the agents' reports: vowel_agent: {vowel_report} consonant_agent: {consonant_report}. Produce a complete PDDL domain and a PDDL problem suitable for FastDownwards that encodes the initial configuration and the goal configuration and enforces that only top blocks can be moved and that agents can only move blocks of their allowed letter types. Keep vowel_agent and consonant_agent actions distinct and atomic. Enclose the domain in <domain></domain> and the problem in <problem></problem>.
